summary: This bill, the Greater Yellowstone Recreation Enhancement And Tourism Act, aims to designate specific river segments within the Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem in Montana as components of the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System. This designation seeks to protect these areas' natural values and recreational opportunities. The bill details the specific segments included (Madison River, Gallatin River, Hyalite Creek, Cabin Creek, and Middle Fork of Cabin Creek), outlines permitted activities and limitations. It also addresses the impact on existing infrastructure, private property rights, and water rights, including the Hebgen and Madison Dams. The bill authorizes appropriations to implement the Act.
